title: doubt
comment: Uncertainty about the truth and reality of spiritual things, as seen especially in a lack of faith in and commitment to God.

children.title: doubt, nature of
children.comment: Doubt leads to insecurity and lack of trust concerning God's willingness and ability to deliver his people. It also leads to a fear of people and situations.

children.title: Doubt as a questioning of God's words
Doubt as insecurity about relationship with God
Doubt as fear of people and situations
doubt, results of
children.comment: Doubt results in uncertainty and ineffectiveness in the spiritual life of individual believers and of the believing community. God appeals to those who waver to make a clear choice.

children.title: Uncertainty about the meaning of life
Uncertainty about the will of God
Doubt may result in a spiritual decline
Doubt may result in drifting from faith
Doubt may result in faithless action
Doubt brings the risk of God's judgment
Doubt leads to ineffectiveness in prayer
God's appeal for a clear decision
doubt, dealing with
children.comment: Uncertainty may be remedied by gaining assurance from God's word, remembering God's past goodness, reflecting on his power and appealing to his unfailing love. Believers should help the weak with the patience and encouragement that reflects God's own compassion.

children.title: Doubt dealt with by holding on to God's truth
Receiving correction and understanding through God's word
Doubt dealt with by meditating on God's works

primaryrefs.comment: Religious festivals such as Passover provided a permanent reminder of God's past goodness to his people.

children.title: Remembering God's concern for the weak
God's grace to those with doubts

primaryrefs.comment: God responds to Moses' uncertainty by promising a demonstration of his power.

children.title: Pastoral concern for those who doubt
